meanings.definition: A framework of latticework used for supporting vines or plants.
meanings.sent1: The treillages in the garden provide a sturdy structure for the climbing roses.
meanings.sent2: The treillages along the fence help the ivy grow upwards.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the treillages as monkey bars.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts intertwined like the treillages in the garden, creating a complex pattern.
meanings.sent5: The treillages cast beautiful shadows on the ground as the sun set.

meanings.definition: A decorative pattern of interlaced strips of wood or metal.
meanings.sent1: The treillages on the cabinet doors added an elegant touch to the room.
meanings.sent2: The treillages on the window frames created a charming design.
meanings.sent3: She admired the treillages on the gate, imagining them as a secret code.
meanings.sent4: The treillages of light and shadow danced on the floor, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The treillages of the metal sculpture caught the sunlight in a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: To construct or decorate with treillages.
meanings.sent1: They decided to treillages the pergola to add a touch of nature to the structure.
meanings.sent2: She carefully treillages the arbor with delicate vines.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to treillages the fence with colorful ribbons, but it didn't quite work.
meanings.sent4: Her words treillages a beautiful picture of a blooming garden in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist treillages the canvas with intricate patterns, bringing it to life.
